title: If k=a-b^a-b, what is the value of k when a = -1 and b = -2? - Quora

response.answer_text: k=a-b^a-bPutting a=-1 and b=-2k=(-1-(-2))^-1-2k=(-1+2)^-3k=(1)^-3k=1In case last term -b is not in the exponent than the solution will be different ask=-1-(-2)^(-1) -(-2)k=1-(-1/2)+2k=1+1/2+2k=(2+1+4)/2k=7/2
